title.native: GATE 自衛隊 彼の地にて、斯く戦えり
title.romaji: GATE: Jieitai Kanochi nite, Kaku Tatakaeri

description:
The military fantasy series begins when a gate appears in Tokyo's Ginza district sometime in the 21st century. From the gate pours out monsters, knights from middle-age Europe, and other fantasy-like beings, and they kill many of the citizens of Tokyo. This event is known as the Ginza Incident.

The government sends a small group of soldiers from the Japanese Self-Defense Forces (a replacement for Japan's military) to the alternate world beyond the gate. Led by otaku soldier Youji, they find that the villages in the world are being attacked by a dragon. An elf girl who is a survivor from the dragon's rampage joins the group in their travels across the dangerous new world.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Tanks
tags.description: Prominently features the use of tanks or other armoured vehicles.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takumi899)
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jacomamire)

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.
[Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30226) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/okome_di)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/254528/)._
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jacomamire)

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Profile](http://www.pro-baobab.jp/ladies/kanemoto_h/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kanemoto-hisako)

Hisako Kanemoto was raised in Okayama Prefecture and attended Kamogata High School. Upon graduation, she enrolled in the voice acting course at the Vocational School of Art College Kobe. After completing her education in 2008, she moved to Tokyo and joined the training office associated with Production Baobab agency.

Early in her career, Kanemoto used the pseudonym _Juri Aikawa_. She made her anime debut in [Sora no Manimani](https://anilist.co/anime/6098) in 2009 under this name. After landing the lead role in [So Ra No Wo](https://anilist.co/anime/6802) To the following year, Kanemoto announced that she would be using her real name in her works moving forward. She was also cast as the title character in [Shinryaku! Ika Musume](https://anilist.co/anime/8557) later that year.

After a breakthrough 2010, Kanemoto was named Best New Actress at the 5th Seiyuu Awards. She has also voiced a number of mascot characters from Okayama Prefecture because of her origin.

Kanemoto made her debut as a solo musical artist in 2014 under Victor Entertainment with the album Fantastic Voyage.

On May 26, 2018 she announced on her official blog that she will take hiatus from professional activities for studying abroad. Her agency Production BAOBAB confirmed her return to work in March 2019.

__Non-anime roles:__

__Height:__ 152 cm
__Agency:__ Intention 

[Artist Profile](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Profile/A023615.html) | [Official Site](http://toyamanao.com/) | [Official Club](http://fc.toyamanao.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/toyamanao/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/naobou_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/naobou_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/naobou_channel) | [Wiki (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nao_T%C5%8Dyama) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%9D%B1%E5%B1%B1%E5%A5%88%E5%A4%AE)

__Radio Programs:__
- (2014-2017) Touyama Nao's Dream * Theater
- (2017-) Touyama Nao's Radio @ Living

__Awards:__ 
- (2019-03-09) Best Supporting Actress Award at the 13th Annual Seiyuu Awards
- (2019-03-09) Game Award at the 13th Annual Seiyuu Awards

__Early Life & Education__
She was born in Tokyo on March 11, 1992. Her father had spent 9 years abroad and was fluent in English, which allowed her to develop fluency in the language. From an early age she had an interest in anime, in particular the series _Ojamajo Doremi_ and _Sailor Moon_. However, it was the anime series _Fullmetal Alchemist_ that was the first to inspire her to become a voice actress. At the time, she was impressed that the series' protagonist Edward Elric was voiced by a female actress, [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/Romi-Park).

In junior high school and high school, she became part of a chorus club to help her overcome her tone deafness. It was also during this time she decided to pursue a voice acting career as she had interacted with schoolmates who had similar interests. Her parents approved of her decision, provided that she pass her university entrance exams. 

__Voice Acting Career__
While in high school, she began attending the Japan Narration Acting Institute. After 3 years of training, she passed her audition and joined the agency Arts Vision. At the same time, she also passed her entrance exam and began studying at Waseda University. She debuted as a voice actress in 2010 and later that year she played her first main role in the anime series _The World God Only Knows_. Throughout her 4 years in University, she continued to work as a voice actress, successfully managing both her work and school responsibilities. She graduated in March 2014 and left Art Vision shortly after on April 1. On May 1, 2014, she transferred to the agency Intention and is currently affiliated with them today.

__Music Career__
Her music career began when she released songs for _The World God Only Knows_ under her character name Kanon Nakagawa. In 2013, she became part of the music group Rhodanthe*, which performed theme songs for the _Kiniro Mosaic_ series. After having been cast in 2015, she has also released singles as her Idolmaster character Mizuki Kawashima. In 2016, she voiced a member of the in-universe music group Walküre, which performed songs for the anime series _Macross Δ_.

In 2017, she made her solo debut as a singer on February 1 with the release of her single "True Destiny" / "Chain the World" under the Flying Dog label. Later that year, her second single "Ima Koko" / "Tsuki ga Kirei" was released on May 24 as well as her first album _Rainbow_ on October 25. In 2018, she held her first solo live event at the Nippon Budokan on February 3 and released her third single "Tomoshibi no Manima ni" on May 30. In 2019, she released her second album _Gunjou Infinity_ on April 3. During the months of August and September, she held her first tour live event performing in the cities of Osaka, Nagoya, and Yokohama as well as cities outside of Japan like Taipei and Shanghai. In 2020, her fourth single "Aruite Ikou!" is set to release on February 5.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Misono Mika in "Blue Archive" (VG)
- Mualani in "Genshin Impact" (VG)
- Juna Crawford - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)

__Agency:__ Office Osawa
 
[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/tanedarisa/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tane_da_dayo/)

On September 1, 2016, Office Osawa announced that Taneda would put her career on hiatus to focus on treatment for her throat, various roles she done were recast during this time such as Erina Nakiri from Food Wars who was replaced by Hisako Kanemoto from Season 3 and onwards.

On August 4, 2017, Office Osawa announced that her treatment was successful and she would gradually return to voice acting.

__Non-anime roles:__
~!
• D.Va in "Overwatch" (VG)
• Kuon in Utawarerumono (VG series)
• Shirasu Azusa in Blue Archive (VG)
!~

node.description:
__[Website](https://kisidakyoudan.com/)__ | __[Website (Warner Bros Japan)](https://whv-amusic.com/kisidakyoudan/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kisida_info)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kisidakyoudan/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCl7OsED7y9eavZJbTGnK0xg/videos)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kisidakyodan/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1zPnpAM7fGFr7pl8OSNvak?si=ZPjWJdhFSR-cVEZHiynphQ)__ | __[Spotify (kishidakyoudan)](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0V8dBE2G0SkXl7GoWnflOk?si=95X396W9RLCizLym_eGy2A)__

__Introduction:__
Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets is a Japanese rock band under record label Warner Bros Home Entertainment (2013–), having previously been under Geneon Universal (2010–2011). The band initially formed as a one-man unit under the name Kishida Kyoudan (stylized as kishidakyoudan) in 2004. The band made its independent debut in 2005 with the album SUPERNOVA, while still continuing to release the next four albums under the name Kishida Kyoudan, before changing their name to Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets in 2007.

__Biography:__
The band began in 2004 as a one-man unit consisting of the musician Kishida, who dedicated his time to cover songs from various series. One prominent series which he covered a lot was the Touhou Project, in addition to  other video games by Japanese visual novel studio [Key](http://key.visualarts.gr.jp/). He would go on to release a CD in 2005 featuring original songs and covers of various songs from the Type-Moon games and the Touhou Project, which he featured for sale at the Winter Comiket in the same year.

In 2007, Kishida received a request to perform at the Touhou live event "Flowering Night", he accepted and gathered various members regardless of personality or experience to form the unit "Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets". They originally planned to disband after performing at the event, but due to unexpected positive feedback from the audience they decided to continue as a band. Later, in the same year, the vocalist ichigo also joined the band.

The band made their major debut in July 2010 through NBCUniversal Entertainment (who at the time were known as Geneon Universal), performing the single titled "HIGHSCHOOL OF THE DEAD" in the anime with the same name _[HIGHSCHOOL OF THE DEAD](https://anilist.co/anime/8074/Gakuen-Mokushiroku-HIGHSCHOOL-OF-THE-DEAD/)_. The full single was released a month later on August 18, 2010, which was their first single release as Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets, which was a whole three years after officially starting band activities. Additionally their first album titled "POPSENSE" was released a year later on June 22, 2011, spanning a total of eleven tracks.

Skipping three years ahead to 2013, the band would make its reappearance in anime performing the single titled "STRIKE THE BLOOD" to the show with the same name _[STRIKE THE BLOOD](https://anilist.co/anime/18277/Strike-the-Blood/)_, while on December 24, 2014 they would release their second album titled "hack/SLASH", which also spanned a total of eleven tracks.

In 2015, on July 5, and in the following year 2016, on January 9, the band would make two consecutive appearances in the anime _[GATE](https://anilist.co/anime/20994/Gate-Jieitai-Kanochi-nite-Kaku-Tatakaeri/)_, and its sequel _[GATE II](https://anilist.co/anime/21364/Gate-Jieitai-Kanochi-nite-Kaku-Tatakaeri-2/)_, performing the singles "GATE (Sore wa Akatsuki no You ni)" and  "GATE II (Sekai o Koete)". The full versions of the singles released on July 29, 2015 and on January 27, 2016 respectively. They would, in addition, go on to make two more appearances in anime in 2016, with the first one being in _[Alderamin on the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/21410/Nejimaki-Seirei-Senki-Tenkyou-no-Alderamin/)_ on July 9, performing the single "Tenkyou no Alderamin" and on November 23, performing the single "BLOOD ON THE EDGE", in the show _[Strike the Blood II](https://anilist.co/anime/21815/Strike-the-Blood-II/)_.

__Members:__
- [Kishida](https://anilist.co/staff/153287/Kishida) (岸田) – bassist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics, composition and arrangement
- [ichigo](https://anilist.co/staff/257500/Ichigo) – vocalist
- [Hayapi](https://twitter.com/hayapi_san_V3) (はやぴ～) – lead guitarist
- [Micchan](https://twitter.com/MI_CYAN_GOGO) (みっちゃん) – drummer

__Support Members:__
- [T-tsu](https://twitter.com/t_tsu8) (てっ), also known as T-tsu-chan (てっちゃん) – guitarist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ei_aoki)

Ei Aoki is a Japanese storyboard artist and director. He credits the anime Megazone 23 as his inspiration to have a career in animation. In 2013, he created the animation studio Troyca with Toshiyuki Nagano and Tomonobu Kato, which began animation production on its first work in the fall of 2014.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/118019011)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/118019011)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jacomamire)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jacomamire)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kameari_Kanata)
Wilhelm Richard Wagner was a German composer, theatre director, polemicist, and conductor who is chiefly known for his operas/music dramas.

Though he was a Physics major at Chiba University, he joined an Anime Research Club that inspired him to enter the industry. He started as a Production Assistant affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures) and gradually moved to directorial roles.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroyuki2212)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1726049540)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kisida67)__

__Kishida__ is a Japanese musician, composer and lyricist. He is also a bassist, guitarist, founder and leader of the band [Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets](https://anilist.co/staff/112181/Kishida-Kyoudan--The-Akeboshi-Rockets).

__[Website](http://yamadaman.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_yamadaman_)__

__Birthplace:__ Kyoto Prefecture, Japan

__Takahiro Yamada__ is a Japanese composer and arranger.
